msIdentifier.repository: Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin - Preußischer Kulturbesitz, Berlin

msItem.title: Notes
msItem.explicit: dabei in allen 4 Vernderungen noch die Reimbuchstaben

msItem.title: Gríms rímur og Hjálmars
msItem.rubric: Hier birjar rimur af Karl og Grym Suia kongum og af Hialmar Hareckssuni a Biarmalande.
msItem.incipit: Karl hefur heited kongur sa er keppum atte ad rada
msItem.explicit: Syr og skyr var dogling fgur drottum þotte ollum frgur

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

msItem.title: Hálfs saga og Hálfsrekka
msItem.rubric: Hier byrjast Sogu Thattur af Alfe Konge og Reckum hanns.
1. Cap. Fra Alfreki konge a Alfreckstodum og Geirhillde drifs dottur.
msItem.incipit: Alfrekur hiet kongur er bio a Alfrekstodum, hann ried fyrer Herdalande hann atte Signiu
msItem.explicit: Geyrmundur Heliarskinn nam Medalfellsstrond i Breydafyrde, Yrihiet dottir hanns og er þadann mikil tt kominn.

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

msItem.title: Hrómundar saga Gripssonar
msItem.incipit: Sa kongur riede firer Gordum, er Olafur hiet, hann var son Gnodar Asmundar, hann var, frgur madur.
msItem.explicit: þau untust vel, attu sonu og dtur til samans og voru afbragd annara. Eru af þeim komnar Konga tter og kappar mikler.
msItem.finalRubric: Og lykur hier svo sogu Hromunds Greypssonar.

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

msItem.title: Hálfdanar saga Brönufóstra
msItem.rubric: Hier hefur Sogu af Halfdane Bronufostra
1. Cap. Fra Hringe dana Kongi ok bornum hanns.
msItem.incipit: Hringur er kongur nefndur, hann rieþi fyrir danmork
msItem.explicit: enn sa sem feck dottur Bronu, varþ kongur, i danmark,
msItem.finalRubric: ok lykur her sogu Halfdanar Bronu fostra.

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

msItem.title: Sörla saga sterka
msItem.rubric: Hier hefur Sogu af Sorla Sterka.
1. Cap. Fra bornum Erlings Upplendinga Kongs.
msItem.incipit: J þann tima, þa er Halfdan Kongur Bronufostri reþi Sviþioþ, setti hann Kasto mag sinn fyrer England, ok giorþi hann þar at Hertoga, þa reþi sa Kongur fyrer Upplondum er Erlingur het
msItem.explicit: enn Hogni giordi þorir at Jarli ok slitu þeir fostbrþur ok þorir alldrei vinattu sina meþann þeir lifdu.
msItem.finalRubric: Ok endast her nu Sorla Saga.

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

msItem.title: Hálfdanar saga Eysteinssonar
msItem.incipit: A fyrri manna alldrum styrþi Kongur sa Noreigie, sem Eysteirn hiet, hann var mikilmenni ok auþugur
msItem.explicit: Enn dottir Halfdanar hiet Yngibiorg hvoria syþann atti Agriþþa Kongur, sem var faþir Fertrams ok Plato.
msItem.finalRubric: Ok endast hier Saga Halfdanar Kongs Eysteinssonar.

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

msItem.title: Samsons saga fagra
msItem.incipit: Artus het Kongur, er reþi fyrer Einglandi, hann var rikur fiolmennur, ok hofþingi mikill, hann atti sier drottningu af dyrum ttum
msItem.explicit: ein rik fru ofundsiuk, er Elida het, sendi hana Eingland Artus kongi, oc ris þar af Skickiu saga.

filiation.ref: The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810.

support.watermark: PROPATRIA and a knight with a lance, accompanied by a lion.

foliation.p: Foliated in pencil in the top outer corners. The front fly-leaf is foliated as the first leaf, the back fly-leaf is not foliated.

layout.note: Written in dark ink in one column throughout with 21 to 29 lines, although usually with 24 to 26 lines. Verses are indented. The lines of the rímur in the first item (fols. 2r-10v) are numbered in the left margins. Chapter headings are in their own lines and centered. The spacious side margins of the written area were folded instead of drawn with a line. The top margins have been trimmed quite close to the text, the other margins are not trimmed, except the bottom margins of bifolio 84+87. Some proper names and important phrases are underlined in dark ink, although in blue on fols 140r, 146r, 149v-150r and 152r.

handDesc.handNote: Unknown hand fols. 2r-152r. Same hand as MS Germ qu. 884 (except the beginning) and MS Germ. qu. 935.

additions.p: Fol. 34r, top margin: Merkwürdiges Zeugniß in der Sturlungasaga, daß die Hromundssaga schon 1119 bei einem Gastmal erzählt worden. vid. Müller isl. Gesch. schr. p. 42. Fol. 92r, right margin: sumir aslaug. moþir. Fol. 123v, left margin: lutu and: skap. Fol. 124r, right margin: conf. ob himilitud vilK. S. cap. 85. Fol. 126r, right margin: margar. Fol. 126v, left margin: Gygiu Fol. 127v, left margin: hic: legendum sveum and hun. Fol. 128v, left margin: Dokin, Hundin. Fol. 129v, left margin: hic, til hennar leg. Fol. 132r, right margin: hefi. Fol. 132v, left margin: Jngina. Fol. 135r, right margin: unnsta. Fol. 138v, left margin: Jng. Jng. Fol. 145v, left margin: Lgel (magelond.). Fol. 147r, right margin: hernaþ. Fol. 151v, left margin: Ulfur. Marginalia always concern the text, and are very often corrections to the text. All marginalia and the items on fol. 1r-v are by Jacob Grimm. On some leaves there is the red, circular stamp of the library: Ex Biblioth. Regia Berolinensi.

binding.p: Faded brown/purple cardboard binding. Red label with the shelf mark in gold print on the spine: Ms Germ. Quart. 936.

37 quires, each consisting of two conjoint bifolia (e.g. quire I fols 2+5, 3+4); except quire III consisting of only one conjoint bifolium (fols. 10+11), quire VIII consisting of two conjoint bifolia and an additional conjoint bifolium (fols. 28+31, 29+30, 32+33, fol. 32 is glued to 31 at the spine), quire X consisting of two conjoint bifolia with an additional conjoint bifolium (fols 38+41, 39+40, 42+43, fol. 42 is glued to 41 at the spine), quire XVIII consisting of two conjoint bifolia (fols. 76+77, 78+79), quire XXIII consisting of one singleton and one conjoint bifolium (fols. 96, 97+98), and the last quire XXXVII consisting of one conjoint bifolium (fols. 151+152).

history.origin: Probably written in the first quarter of the nineteenth century, as Grimm's marginalia are in Kurrent - a script he stopped using between 1821 and 1824. The manuscript is a copy of Biörner's "Nordiska kämpa dater" (Stockholm, 1737), and the brothers Grimm borrowed the edition from the University Library of Göttingen between 1809 and 1810, when they also had a handwritten copy made of it. The handwritten copy consists most likely of the manuscripts MS Germ qu. 935 and MS Germ qu. 396 (see a letter dated 1811 to Benecke, printed in: Briefe der Brüder Grimm an Georg Friedrich Benecke aus den Jahren 1808-1829, ed. by Wilhelm Müller, Göttingen, 1889, p. 28). Gottzmann states that Wilhelm Grimm borrowed Biörner's edition no later than 1807, see Gottzmann, Die altnordischen Studien und Publikationen von Wilhelm und Jacob Grimm. in: Brüder Grimm Gedenken 7, ed. Ludwig Denecke (Marburg, 1987) p. 67.

provenance.p: The brothers Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm were owners of the manuscript. How and when it came into their possession is not known, but they were most likely the commissioners of it. In 1865, two years after the death of Jacob Grimm in 1863, the German government bought his library and gave all the manuscripts to the Königliche Bibliothek, now Deutsche Staatsbibliothek - Preußischer Kulturbesitz.

revisionDesc.change: Markup adjusted. Additional information added based on SVH's diss.
